thread.title: Former Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta blames FBI for election loss
thread.title_full: Former Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta blames FBI for election loss

title: Former Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta blames FBI for election loss

organizations.name: house oversight and government reform committee

text:
Former Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta blames FBI for election loss Before you go, we thought you'd like these... READ MORE Feb 22nd 2017 12:54AM 
The man in charge of Hillary Clinton's 2016 presidential campaign remains convinced the FBI is to blame for her loss. 
John Podesta was Clinton's campaign chairman, and he recently sat down for an interview with John Heilemann to discuss the election and factors that may have contributed to Clinton's loss. 
"There are at least forces within the FBI that wanted her to lose," Podesta said. "I'm not sure they really understood the alternative, but they wanted her to lose. I think that's one possibility." 
James Comey through the years 6 PHOTOS James Comey through the years See Gallery James Comey through the years FBI Director James Comey adjusts his tie before testifying to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence hearing on ?Russia?s intelligence activities" on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., January 10, 2017. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts FBI Director James Comey testifies before a House Oversight and Government Reform Committee on the "Oversight of the State Department" in Washington U.S. July 7, 2016. REUTERS/Gary Cameron WASHINGTON, DC - JANUARY 13: FBI Director James Comey arrives at the U.S. Capitol for a classified briefing on Russia for all members of the House of Representatives January 13, 2017 on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC. The internal Office of the Inspector General at the Justice Department announced yesterday that it is conducting a review on the handling of FBI and DOJ's investigation into the Hillary Clinton private e-mail server case. (Photo by Alex Wong/Getty Images) FBI Director James Comey testifies to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence hearing on ?Russia?s intelligence activities" on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., January 10, 2017. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts WASHINGTON, DC - JANUARY 10: FBI Director James Comey and Director of National Intelligence James Clapper (L-R) arrive to testify before the Senate (Select) Intelligence Committee in the Dirksen Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill January 10, 2017 in Washington, DC. The intelligence heads testified to the committee about cyber threats to the United States and fielded questions about effects of Russian government hacking on the 2016 presidential election. (Photo by Joe Raedle/Getty Images) Up Next
